Title: Business Change Manager, Investment Trading
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a global investment manager, we help institutions, intermediaries and individuals across the planet meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future. But as the world changes, so do our clients’ needs. That’s why we have a long history of adapting to suit the times and keeping our focus on what matters most to our clients. Doing this takes experience and expertise. We bring together people and data to spot the trends that will shape the future. This provides a unique perspective which allows us to always invest with conviction. We are responsible for £418.2 billion (€476.3 billion/$543.3 billion)* of assets for our clients who trust us to deliver sustainable returns. We remain determined to build future prosperity for them, and for all of society. Today, we have 4,100 people across six continents who focus on doing just this. We are a global business that’s managed locally. This allows us to always keep our clients’ needs at the heart of everything we do. For over two centuries and more than seven generations we’ve grown and developed our expertise in tandem with our clients’ needs and interests. Explore our interactive timeline to see how we’ve been shaping financial futures since our very beginnings. *as at 30 June 2017       Overview   The Investment Operations Team is a central team within Investment, reporting to the Investment COO with a global remit. The team provides support to the other Investment Teams in the Schroders Asset Management Business and works with teams across Schroders to implement change. The team aims to enable business growth, support business as usual, make data improvements, manage risk and simplify the business.   As the Business Change Manager, you are responsible for all aspects Investment project delivery of business change and investment support for Schroders based in focussing on the dealing desk change requirements. You will report to Trading Business Change Manger based in London with a dotted line to the Head of Investment Change, APAC. You will be responsible for defining requirements and delivering improvements to Investment’s platform. The focus of the role will be to work with the Trading Team in the analysis of current business process and workflow in order to identify strengths, weaknesses, potential efficiencies and best practice. The jobholder will be required to design target processes and workflows to support the strategic vision of Investment. You will also have to work closely with senior management, asset class specialists and business change to design, agree and communicate any proposed changes. They may then work within a wider team to deliver the agreed business change or hand over to a separate delivery team for implementation.     Key Responsibilities:     Aladdin  To provide support to the Investment Platform – Aladdin, by owning a business analysis stream for trading based in Singapore, covering the region and working closely with the global team to provide global comprehensive solutions to the investment functions.    Support  Assist in the definition of new business requirements and the design of new processes. To aide in the delivery of incremental benefit to the global trading Team. To keep up to date with regulations and new instruments, to understand business requirements, facilitate decision making and support prioritisation. To maintain relations with the trading team and act as a conduit relaying their requirements and feeding them in to Investment Operations.    Capability Owner (Trading)  Drive and facilitate investment business change across the global trading desks Work closely with the BlackRock Solutions teams on enhancements and defects identified Provide requirements and solutions to the Aladdin related functionality Represent the trading capability priorities in global forums Gather and document End to End business requirements relating to investment initiatives Support the regional dealing desks in their initiatives to further develop their Algorithmic capabilities  Promote innovation among the investment teams, and help to facilitate new initiatives such as robotics and machine learning within the trading desk. Facilitate the on-boarding of new Investment Systems, New Instruments & Process Consult and/or lead the organization design process for future organizational changes Chair monthly meetings with stakeholders and capability managers For part of the overall Investment Platform community within Investment Operations. Title: Regional Recruiter
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe team and the role In Deliveroo we’ve ran out of desks in two offices in the last 6 months, that’s the scale and speed we’re hiring at.  So it won’t be a surprise to hear that recruitment here plays a huge part in Deliveroo’s story so far. You’ll join a team of recruiters aiming to hit some incredible recruitment heights in what promises to be another year of hyper growth.   Some of the things you’ll be doing in the next 12 months:     Hiring.  A lot. Account Management, Business Development, Data Analytics, Marketing, Operations & Customer Service - you’ll be sourcing, interviewing, closing and on boarding people in these disciplines for existing market Singapore, Dubai, Hong Kong & Australia   Becoming a ‘go to person’ to Deliveroo on all things recruitment - from interview process to comp packages to market know-how.  You’ll own recruitment end to end and drive it rather than support it.   Working with the recruitment and hiring teams at Deliveroo to fine tune recruitment processes.   Building pipeline for campus recruitment   Recruitment projects - there’s no shortage so if you want to pick something up here - go for it.  From interview training to candidate onboarding to our careers page to name just a few. If you’re interested in these things, then they’re yours to do.
Requirements: RequirementsJob requirements and some things we’d like to see in you    Experience in recruitment - either internal experience or a solid billing history in an agency.  People skills.  You believe in the power of communication and focus on building relationships long term.  Don’t hide behind IM’s, it’s all about the face time.   You’re able to source and hire awesome people directly without depending on recruitment agencies.   As a recruiter, you don’t rely on a candidate database to find people.  You should be able to source people using some pretty bog standard tools beyond Linkedin.  Tools from yesteryear such as Connectifier and Context Scout will hopefully mean something to you.  We’d love it if you can bring some sourcing tricks with you too.   A passion for an amazing and seamless interview experience for both candidates and hiring teams.   Attention to detail :-) plenty of it please!   You thrive in an environment of unrelenting pace.  The ability to multitask, juggle a bunch of stuff at once but also, somehow manage to be super organised at the same time is key here.    A sense of humour - dry, sarcastic, slapstick, sadistic - it doesn’t matter, just have one please!    Benefits     An excellent recruitment team (if we do say so ourselves) to work with, learn from and share ideas with.   Autonomy to do your job the way you want to do it.   Fantastic experience at one of Europe’s fastest growing startups.   Regular off-sites with the team, game nights and the legendary “Bun-day Monday”.   Food.  So much food.  Nom Nom.   We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing start ups around.

Title: Category Performance Manager
Responsibility: Roles & Responsibilities  The Category Performance Manager, Respiratory Asia-Pac is responsible for sustained accelerated growth of the Respiratory business in Asia Pac region by providing commercial marketing leadership at the interface of Global Respiratory Category and Asia-Pac Region operations. Key driver of CPM delivering growth via driving stronger execution plans with local area teams, firm alignment & robust planning, and creating value through powerful category programs across the five Asia-Pac Areas (ANZ, JK, GC, ISC and SEA). The successful candidate will be responsible for driving business results and ensuring improved commercial success for this critical GSK Category/Region combination. They will act as a key support for the AP LT and provide a simple interface to the matrix Category organisation to ensure voice of the AsiaPac region is internalized to secure appropriate resources and accountability.  Responsibilities  • Supports 3-1 Business Planning to maximise growth from Respiratory Category within the AP region • Identifies critical brand/market combinations for growth, develops robust plans and key must dos for the area and category to deliver robust growth and monitor performance to “course correct” quickly to stay on target • Drives stronger marketing activation plans in the region with the area marketing teams, through leveraging shopper/analytics/MRD research & modeling to identify opportunities for improvement and optimizing plans in real time to deliver sales and share growth. • Supports flawless delivery of execution and local amplification of Category programs and assets including innovation launches • Effectively identifies and spreads best practice and performance learning across the region to drive growth • Drives brand growth learnings and needs for the AsiaPac region into category to ensure Brand Programs address these key needs. In addition, ensure there is clarity on what will be in the Brand Programs for the area to leverage and what activities will need to be addressed by the area/LOC. • The eyes and ears of Category in-market to identify competitive activity and ensure GSK delivers programs to win – driving performance agility • Responsible for thorough understanding of key needs to win “instore”, and drives continuous improvement of materials/executions through the partnership with the shopper & expert area/category teams to deliver • Management of Asia Pacific Respiratory Health P&L and performance in each of the 5 Areas deliver target and growth ambitions.  • Primary measures are Sales, Profit & Market Share growth plus pipeline value and innovation sales for Respiratory Power, Core and local brand assets in the region • Enables stronger Innovation delivery & increased pipeline value through clear transfer of actionable insights, stronger alignment in innovation planning, securing effective category and local resourcing and stronger execution of commercialisation plans. • Represents Asia-Pac requirements to Category PMB and stewards critical Asia Pac projects through the stage & gate process • Driving successful new business models to support new business growth and geographical expansion of Power brands in priority geographies – focus on consumer value platforms enabled by data and devices, emerging market development strategies, leveraging e-commerce and enterprise partnership with other GSK business units to drive profitable penetration • Identifies, assesses, prioritises and supports transaction for appropriate Regional M&A/Licensing to deliver on strategy and create value, securing appropriate Category resources as appropriate. • Secures appropriate category resources for Asia-Pac to enhance delivery of programmes and accelerate growth • Supports regional marketing and commercial capability development • Responsible for stewarding power and core brand equities in AP markets,  • Aligned and effective ways of working with the 5 Area Marketing Teams and local market activation teams in priority AP geographies to ensure performance success.  The role and region is highly multi-cultural in nature and the successful candidate will need to inspire and engage with customer-facing teams across the globe, adapting their approach to reflect cultural, capability & language diversity. The role will be recruited in line with GSK’s commitment to diversity and appropriate hiring policies.  The role requires the ability to solve complex commercial problems at pace and partner at a global, region and local level across all levels of the organisation hierarchy. This is a highly visible role and the successful candidate must be able to demonstrate a high level of impact, both in personal style and through business results. Equally, the candidate is co-located with the Region team and remote from the Category teams and so must build powerful relationships through effective business communication and presence. A significant amount of travel is expected to achieve success.

Emerging market experience is essential, developed market experience is preferred. • Effective leveraging of the business P&L is essential with full financial and commercial literacy. • Preference for sales experience that includes customer-facing experience and/or route-to-market experience  • Local or regional brand experience, deep Consumer/Expert/Shopper/Retail understanding  • Ability to identify and codify growth levers and performance drivers that matter in simple and concise manner quickly and continuously improve plans to exploit • Has experience of complex innovation programs and governance processes • Confident communicator and leader capable of innovative thinking, engaging others and inspiring confidence in their ideas.  • End to end commercial experience & credibility, can leverage the entire Value Chain to drive growth  • Strong organization skills and can effectively manage own time and resources and use others resourcefully  • Ability to build strong relationships via trust and collaboration • Ability to work remotely with self-motivation to stay connected with virtual team members • Experience of working with Healthcare Experts and Influencers to drive brand equity and growth  • Proven success in a range of products, categories, markets and/or business challenges  • Emotional intelligence, agility and experience of multiple, distinctly different cultures   Personal Attributes   • Motivated by mission, drive to want to improve health and lives • Strong business acumen and deep understanding of customers and consumers • Personal curiosity to continue to focus versus over-reliance on process • Team orientated, collaborative style combined with a clear accountability for delivery and results • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, Company: TECHNOLOGY CENTRE FOR OFFSHORE AND MARINE, SINGAPORE LTD.
Title: SCIENTIST (TCOMS)
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Technology Centre for Offshore and Marine Singapore TCOMS is a national Centre of Excellence established by the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) and the National University of Singapore (NUS) to spur research excellence and advance Singapore’s Marine & Offshore Engineering (M&OE) industry. The Centre is also supported by the Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB) and the Maritime & Port Authority of Singapore (MPA), and seeks to develop and validate innovative concepts and solutions for M&OE operations. Through strategic global partnerships with industry and research institutions, TCOMS aims to push frontiers in the development of safe, reliable and sustainable future systems for mankind. A key feature of TCOMS is a next-generation Ocean Basin with forefront simulation capabilities. Job Description  Perform research in the areas of offshore hydrodynamics and fluid-structure interactions pertaining to ocean hydrodynamic environment and behaviour of marine & offshore vessels and floating systems in challenging environments. Conduct extensive and high-quality research using combinations of physical experiments, sensing, numerical simulations using CFD and/or potential flow-based models or other relevant techniques, as well as data analytics to develop integrated physical-numerical modelling & simulations. Collaborate with industry partners, affiliated research institutes and other relevant stakeholders to assist in securing further research grants. Any other duties as assigned by supervisor.
Requirements: Requirements A Masters/Ph.D. from reputable universities in Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Ocean Engineering, Marine Engineering, Offshore Engineering, Physical Oceanography, Applied Mathematics or other related disciplines. Preferably 3 years of relevant postdoctoral/research/industry experience with competent knowledge in some of the following areas.     Deep knowledge in using CFD and/or potential flow-based models to model and simulate ocean wave hydrodynamics, such as nonlinear wave-wave interactions, wave breaking, and wave growth evolution. Physical modelling in wave flume, wave tank or ocean basin. Sensing, data analytics and machine learning. Knowledge of following numerical methods/software is an advantage:       Higher Order Spectral Method (HOSM), Boundary Element Method (BEM) or equivalent potential flow method; and OpenFOAM, StarCCM+ or equivalent CFD software     Good interpersonal and communications skills. Ability to adapt and work effectively as members of a team. Good command of written and spoken English language. Resourceful and self-driven with a high degree of professional integrity.  The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: IT Account Lead Regional Franchises
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesMSD seeks to recruit an IT Account Leader who will partner and drive initiatives with the Regional Commercial Leaders (RCL’s), Integrated Customer Engagement (ICE), and Analytics teams within the Asia Pacific (AP) region. The position will be based at the MSD IT Hub Singapore office. The position will have a direct reporting line into the Asia Pacific GHH IT Leader, with a matrix reporting relationship to Global Commercial Capabilities and Global Marketing IT.  This position is required to provide overall IT accountability and partnership to all ICE and analytics initiatives, with a focus on Vaccines and Oncology franchises. The IT Account Lead will:  Support the region in the realization of value through understanding of applicable business opportunities to create value, followed by identification, implementation and realization of appropriate and right—sized IT solutions leveraging enterprise platforms. To enable IT to deliver solutions to differentiate through digital, data analytics, and insights and have input into Commercial Platform and Analytics roadmaps to meet the strategic and operational goals of the business. As a bridge between business challenges, opportunities and enterprise technology solutions and work primarily with GHH, maintain a close relationship with a network of global platform, Country IT and global Marketing IT. Work closely with platform leads and IT product owners to drive implementation and adoption of core commercial capabilities across AP and provide feedback of business needs to support IT product evolution Assure full and continuous compliance with regulatory and company requirements outlined in MSD policy.  Main Tasks & Responsibilities:   Act as the primary IT point of accountability for key franchise teams. This will require regular interactions, solid business relationships and integrated work plans with the relevant business partners and their teams. Act as the primary IT point of accountability for the product launches within the region, working closely with IT Country Leaders and their designate for local market IT activities in support of the regional launch service. Collaborate with global and regional stakeholders, IT Country Leaders and their designate BA to plan and implement regional programs in the required markets. Manage the prioritization of demand for IT services for ICE, Analytics and franchises and act as a focal point for all interactions and escalation with all the other IT organizations including Country Leaders. Work with the RCL’s, ICE Lead, analytics stakeholders to understand business strategies for the region and to develop a Roadmap to align the needs with enterprise capabilities and incorporate the specific requirements into the overall portfolio plan for AP IT. Assure full compliance in line with SDLC guidelines and all other applicable compliance regulations. Prepare and manage IT program budget for designated area. Continuously collaborate with both regional and global business partners to understand current and desired business processes/requirements, as well as corresponding business goals. Support and/or performs the formulation of the portfolio of requirements for the regional franchises, the definition and documentation of business cases in partnership with business and IT partners with associated drivers (return on investment), key performance indicators and other appropriate measures/metrics for value realization. Based on business and IT knowledge, works with regional, global IT partners in the initial development and assessment of solution alternatives ensuring alignment with global IT standards/architecture and adherence to ‘Lean’/Six sigma principles. Documents and verifies business process flows and business requirements. Verify solution’s alignment with requirements. Coordinates the local market implementation with the Country Leader or designate responsible. Leads and drives local (human) change management processes as needed to realize the value of IT innovations / improvements. Building on the responsibilities above, realize business & IT value by   Supporting the regional rollout of globally defined solutions/enhancements while minimizing customization for the region; collaborate in business case development and requirement definition to make sure needs are understood and integrated as applicable, followed by applicable actions to further support the rollout. Communicating and clarifying regional business needs f as the basic driver/starting point for the development of a global solution, following global rollout actions outlined in the bullet above. Leading the development of custom solutions for which no global solution exist and that are not been identified as the basis for a current global system; develop the full business case and requirement definition in combination with the business, and platform teams, followed by applicable further rollout activities for approved business cases.   Tracks key performance indicators and other appropriate measures/metrics to assure projected value realization, and manages/escalates corresponding issues. Keep abreast of new technologies, methodologies, industry practices and standards
Requirements: RequirementsQualifications Education: BSc Degree or equivalent with relevant experience in Computer Science, Computer Science Engineering, Math, or equivalent. MBA or higher Business Degree an advantage.  The candidate should have 10+ years of related experience in areas of business analysis, including 3 years of prior account management experience working with senior leaders in a commercial/sales/marketing regional area of responsibility. Demonstrated experience and proficiency with one or more formal methodologies for business requirements analysis and business process engineering.

Title: Senior Lecturer
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe School of Business (SBIZ) at Singapore University of Social Sciences aims to educate business minds and in the process, transform the lives of our students when they graduate with a business degree. SBIZ currently has more than 4,000 students enrolled in various degree programmes.   Our students are mainly working adults who are keen to upgrade and remain competitive in the fast-paced business world. We also have a sizable group of full-time students pursuing their degree education full time in the University. To equip our students for a better future, we provide them with a curriculum that is industry-relevant and we adopt innovative and practice-oriented pedagogical approaches (e.g. case study, flipped-classroom). Classes are interactive in nature and instructors go beyond lectures and facilitate interactive discussions and activities that require application of theories to solve real world problems. As most of our students are working, they are able to apply what they have learnt in the classroom to real-life scenarios in their workplace almost immediately. This enables them to live out our maxim - Learn Today, Apply Tomorrow.   SBIZ is now recruiting passionate full-time faculty members who are aligned with our education aspirations. The responsibilities of SBIZ full-time faculty members include teaching and developing courses, conducting academic and/or applied research, and managing degree programmes and projects. We are interested in candidates in the following areas:    Accountancy (especially in the areas of Financial Accounting, Managerial Accounting, Assurance, Taxation, Business Valuation and Accounting Theory)  Analytics (especially in the areas of Machine Learning, Data Mining, Text Mining, Statistics, Forecasting, Optimisation, Data Visualisation, Data Management, IoT and Big Data) Business Law Entrepreneurship  Finance Information Systems Project Management Quality Management Supply Chain Management (especially in the areas of Procurement and International Trade  System) Strategy Operations Management Customer Relationship Management Business excellence (especially in the area of SPRING Singapore's Business Excellence framework)
Requirements: Requirements Ph.D. degree holder in a relevant discipline. Ph.D candidates nearing completion will also be considered. Candidate with teaching and/or working experience in the relevant area will have an added advantage. In the area of Finance, candidates with a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) qualification or those in the area of Fintech, crytocurrency and digital banking will have an added advantage. In the area of Accountancy, candidates with a Chartered Accountant of Singapore qualification (or equivalent professional qualification) and at least a Master's degree in a relevant area will also be considered.  In the area of Business Law, candidates with a Bachelor's degree in Law and at least 5 years of relevant working experience will also be considered.    For more information and application, please visit our website: http://www.suss.edu.sg/careers/appointments-vacancies/Pages/Academic-Appointments-(Full-time).aspx (Only shortlisted candidates will be notified)

Title: Regional Demand Planning Manager
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe role of a Regional Demand Planning Manager is to support the overall business, financial & supply chain management process by rigorous management of the demand signals for the various product types and customer channels.  The Regional Demand Planning Manager works with the Regional Brand Management team in the management of the operational demand plan at the aggregate level.  They will play a key role in the Sales Inventory and Operations Planning (SIOP) process by working with the multi-functional teams (namely Regional Supply Planning, Sales, Marketing and Finance) and the Affiliate Demand Planning team to assure tight alignment in the forecast (which will drive the supply, inventory & production plans) and financial plans.   Key Responsibilities:     Develop & facilitate the consensus forecast for the brand (across affiliates) based on statistical forecast and sales & marketing activities such as promotions (GWP, local sets) and new product launches across multiple brands   Become the valued business partner for the Regional Brand Lead & management team   Forecast Development Process Managements:   Ensure the team (affiliate Demand Planners) is leveraging SAP Advanced Planning Optimizer (APO) to utilise the most optimal statistical forecast based on the SKUs demand profile   Ensure appropriate adjustments are done across affiliates based on sales trends, especially for new launches (gross forecast and cannibalizations)   Ensure robust process is in place to facilitate the forecast development of by SKU & aggregate forecast based on the brands intelligence from the multifunctional teams (eg incorporating latest promotion plans, in-market performance of the new launches, competitive activities, macro market trends, customers’ plans, trade inventory etc)   Ensure reasonability of forecast across affiliates based on final brand forecast (operational forecasts) at multiple levels of aggregation for the full time horizon by channels and by key accounts (if applicable)   Ensure robust process is in place to enable close collaboration with regional supply planning and brand & sales team to manage and shape demand especially during extended out of stocks situations    Ensure best practices across affiliates for forecast data preparation, develops an understanding of the used statistical forecast models (Note: intermediate knowledge & understanding of the statistical model is expected to help resolve basic affiliate planners’ needs .  Leverage the regional & global COE for questions/clarifications)   Ensure best practices across affiliates to maintain the Demand Planning Attributes & Masterdata such as Characteristics Value Combinations (CVCs), Product lifecycle (PLC’s), Demand Type (DT), Strategic Indicator (SI), History Start Date (HSD)   Forecast Alignment Process Managements:   Lead the regional branded SIOP meetings focusing on demand trends insights, building blocks assumptions, and share scenarios planning based on risks & opportunity assessments at the appropriate aggregate level (eg product families, product categories)   Ensure robust & standard process across affiliates as part of the Demand input meetings from multifunctional teams (Brand Sales, Marketing, Finance, Supply) by aggregating inputs which would have significant impacts on the sales plan to ensure that the most current and accurate market intelligence is incorporated into the demand plan.   Ensure robust & standard process across affiliates as part of the Demand Review in the monthly SIOP meetings, focus the team on key trends insights and focus the team’s energy on strategic areas which makes the biggest impact to the business (eg key assumptions which assumptions went right/wrong, key demand drivers insights, cannibalization learnings for reapplication, key building blocks assumptions   Lead the regional brand forecast vs LE reconciliation process and ensure the variance is within acceptable tolerance and the major differences are captured as part of the risks & opportunities   Conduct forecast sufficiency & reasonability checks across affiliate and share trends analysis insights and share recommendations   KPI & Process Improvement Managements:   WFA – lead improvement plans across affiliates for the regional Brand via thorough root-cause analysis   Assess and develop the team (branded demand planners network) to become High Performing Organisation   Leverage the regional Demand Planning ACE (Academy & Centre of Excellence) networks to learn/share/reapply best practices to improve results   Ensure best practices are used for SAP & BI reporting analytics (Bias, Attainment, Waterfall etc) to correct forecast bias (ie minimize out of stocks / excess inventory) and improve consistency of attainment   Play the central role of COE for the region by connecting with the global COEs eg to drive process & tools adoptions, benchmark, develop & deploy standard best practices, drive best practices and best statistical forecasting tools adoptions, Resource should be good with BA skills, Agile and Scrum methodology 8-10 years of experience Must have experience ( proven and documented in the resume ) of SBE -  Specification by example (SBE) is a collaborative approach to defining requirements and business-oriented functional tests for software products based on capturing and illustrating requirements using realistic examples instead of abstract statements. It is applied in the context of agile software development methods, in particular behavior-driven development. This approach is particularly successful for managing requirements and functional tests on large-scale projects of significant domain and organisational complexity. Specification by example is also known as example-driven development, executable requirements, acceptance test–driven development (ATDD[2] or A-TDD[3]), Agile Acceptance Testing,[4] Test-Driven Requirements (TDR).

We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. The Go to Market organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.  The Go to Market organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives. Identify gaps in products and build business cases based on advertiser needs. Partner with Global Product Leads on the product roadmap.

Title: Lead UI / UX Designer
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe're looking for passionate, design-driven people to join our proven team as a Lead UI/UX Designer based in Singapore.   Some things to know before you apply team of former investment bankers, product engineers and specialists, and data analysts in developing, monitoring and improving the platform to facilitate the activity of private investing More specifically, you will be leading all design-related work for Fundnel, working closely with our product team consisting a product owner, UI designer, data analytics manager, and a full stack engineering and QA team You will be required to travel on a monthly/quarterly basis to be on-location with our product team based in Jakarta, Indonesia for product and sprint planning and reviews discovery, due diligence and evaluation of all investment opportunities, and business owners in creation and maintenance of all capital raising activities: 	 work with other inhouse UI/UX designers to lead design thinking and UI development of all upcoming product features in accordance with timelines established together with the product owner develop web-ready, hi-fidelity prototypes and other supporting assets for implementation on the platform on, making use of tools such as Sketch, Craft and Invision (across desktop, mobile and tablet interfaces) enforce and ensure robust design quality and viability in line with the product roadmap, working in fixed-interval design sprints to ensure continuous development of the platform consistently and continuously engage, trial, test and prove design thinking and prototypes with internal and external stakeholders work through UX thinking, storyboarding and design best practice to test and validate UI concepts (do not design for design sake, every UI design must be validated through UX) establish, document and help your design team maintain overarching UX and UI standards to create a unified design framework for Fundnel by 4Q 2018   Work with other inhouse designers to lend a hand and support business divisions with design, branding and sales and marketing collaterals Work with the marketing manager to apply design consistencies to all forms of marketing and communication: 	 visuals support for all outgoing marketing campaigns (internal and external stakeholders) media and press enquiry support

Title: Digital Marketing Strategist
Address: RAFFLES CITY TOWER, 250 NORTH BRIDGE ROAD 179101
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJoin Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world.  The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career. The digital revolution is changing everything. It’s everywhere – transforming how we work and play. Are you reacting to the disruption each day or are you leading the way as a digital disrupter? Accenture Digital is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of digital, you’ll create it, own it and make it a reality for clients looking to better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises. Join us and become an integral part of our experienced digital team with the credibility, expertise and insight clients depend on. Accenture Digital is powered by three practices –Mobility, Interactive, and Analytics. As part of our Mobility practice, you’ll help clients deepen connections with consumers, employees, businesses and machines. Of the major digital technologies, mobility has risen to the top in terms of importance to organizations. Most surveyed now consider mobility among their top five priorities. Job Summary: The Digital and Marketing Strategist position is a key role in managing initial client business development interactions and engagements that lead to large-scale platform and managed services solutions. They will work closely with both our clients and our deep solution experts to define the appropriate digital strategy that leverage Accenture Interactive’s digital marketing assets and other leading / bleeding-edge concepts and technologies. Through detailed analyses and a keen understanding of the client situation, the Digital Marketing Strategist will help shape the journey towards agile intelligent marketing.  Key Responsibilities:  Develop global digital marketing strategy for Accenture Interactive clients including performing rigorous analysis to identify potential value creating opportunities, creating the business case and developing the requirements to implement the strategy. Develop requirements to ensure that digital marketing vision and recommendation translate to (and leverage) Accenture Interactive assets, products and services. Lead client assessment portion of strategy engagements, develop cohesive conclusions and present key findings at the executive level. Provide strategy development and solution development to support new business activities and existing client relationships.
Requirements: RequirementsJob Requirements:  This is a client-facing role, requires excellent communication skills along with a willingness to travel up to 80%.  Digital Strategists:  3+ yrs of experience in:     Digital Visionary C-suite presence  Up to date on current and emerging digital and marketing trends  Ability to direct Competitive assessment Ability to generate Customer experience insights Strategy formulation Lead Transformation management  Roadmap and planning  Analytics/Insight generation         Digital Business Architects need the following:      Digital Operating /governance model Organizational design Digital Process design Capability definition    Basic Qualifications:   Minimum of Bachelors degree in related field.   Minimum of 2 years digital marketing consulting experience.   Prefer 1 - 3 years leading large scale strategy engagements.   Professional Qualifications:   Core management consulting skills including:   Workshop facilitation   Client interviews / focus groups   Strong verbal and written communication skills     Client relationship skills and strong business development acumen.   Ability to thrive in an ambiguous/start-up environment as the business develops and scales.   Understanding of broader CMO agenda and how digital fits within the overall marketing scope.   Experience with defining high level enterprise digital architectures and applying digital marketing and development best practices to support strategy recommendations.   Experience partnering with advertising/marketing agencies a plus.   Focus on one or more of the following industries:    Retail   Consumer-packaged Goods   Travel & hospitality   Auto & Industrials   Communications & Hi-Tech   Resources   Financial Services (Insurance, Banking, Capital Mkts)     Focus on one or both of:   B2C   B2B business models     Benefits:  Entrepreneurial spirit and vision will be rewarded, and your success will fuel opportunities for career advancement. You’ll make a difference for some pretty impressive clients. Our Digital practice serves many of the Fortune Global 100 on high-profile projects. Opportunities to learn daily through training, assignments, and collaborating with experts across the company Access to leading-edge technology. Accenture offers our employees a “Total Rewards” package, which includes compensation and a range of market-relevant benefits and professional growth opportunities that recognize individual contributions and performance. We also offer a number of programs that help our employees balance a successful career with a healthy lifestyle involving family, friends and community.  All of our consulting professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills development.  You’ll also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization.  We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. Title: Data Scientist
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJoin the excitement of Artificial Intelligence in the Cloud! We are a fast-paced data science team in the Cloud Artificial Intelligence Platform Group, building deep learning powered intelligent tools and end-to-end solutions for scenarios in diverse enterprise and consumer verticals. We are looking for data scientists who are passionate about data and want to apply machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems for enterprises and consumers. You will help develop capabilities for deep learning models and tools and solutions around it. You would also work on predictive and prescriptive modeling, text and image mining & processing, recommendations, clustering, forecasting methods, and other advanced statistical techniques. You will work with data from diverse structured and unstructured data sources in both batch and streaming modes, and various formats including tabular, image/video, audio, text and time series.  In this role, you will interact with a team of experts in deep learning, machine learning, distributed systems, program management and partner product teams, and work on all aspects of the design, development and delivery of deep learning enabled solutions, including problem definition, data acquisition, exploration, training, testing and evaluating deep learning models, and creating end-to-end pipelines and solutions in production.
Requirements: RequirementsRequired:  • 2+ years of experience (including PhD research) in machine learning or deep learning Preferred: • PhD /MS/BS degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or an equivalent technical field • Experience in any of the deep learning frameworks (Keras, TensorFlow, CNTK, Theano, Caffe, Torch, H2O) • System-level knowledge of deep learning (such as GPU or FPGA implementations) a plus • Strong software development skills in one or more high level languages (C/C++/Java/C#) and one or more scripting languages (Python/R/javascript) • Publications in related fields (deep learning, machine intelligence, data mining, etc.) preferred • Experience building production grade machine learning enabled solutions end to end. • Strong intellectual curiosity and passion to solve real-world problems for enterprises and consumers

Company: SINGAPORE-MIT ALLIANCE FOR RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY CENTRE
Title: Postdoctoral Associate / Research Associate / Research Scientist (Ref: IRG_FM_2018_001)
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesProject Overview Improving the resilience of the Singapore Mass Rapid Transit network (SMRTN) requires both proactive robustification of the network and reactive emergency response planning in cases of disruptions. In light of the SMRTN expansion, the remodeled hub-and-spoke bus network, and new bridging services such as ride-sharing services and automated driving vehicles, building an integrated resilience improvement plan for the SMRTN has become more complex and requires a systematic and tractable methodology. Responsibilities We have an open position for a Postdoctoral Associate at Singapore-MIT Alliance for Research and Technology Centre (SMART) in Singapore. The responsibility of Postdoctoral Associate will be to work on developing strategies obtained from a novel data-driven optimization approach that lays the foundations for cross-disciplinary work among three fully-fledged fields of research, namely, data analytics, statistics, machine learning and optimization.  Analyze big passenger movement datasets for the SMRTN Use the big data analysis results to quantify uncertainties in the SMRTN Build and solve data-driven robust optimization models to improve the resilience of the SMRTN Present research results at top international workshops and conferences, exhibits as well as internal project meetings Co-author articles for publication in top-tier peer-reviewed journals and top conferences
Requirements: RequirementsThe successful candidates must have:  PhD in Computer Science, Complex Systems, Operations Research or a related field. Strong background in big Data Analytics, Data-Driven optimization Statistics, Machine Learning and Mathematical Optimization with a focus on transportation systems. Practical skills in solving optimization models with Python or Matlab or CPLEX are expected Outstanding oral and written communication skills in English as evidenced by ability to develop manuscripts and deliver presentations.  Candidates with an experience in any of the following will have an advantage:  Demonstrated record of independent thinking and innovative scientific accomplishments as evidenced by first-author papers published in premier journals is a strong plus With an interdisciplinary mathematical modeling background. Ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment, problem solving skills and high creativity.      Interested applicants will have to submit their full CV/resume, cover letter and list of three references (to include reference names and contact information). We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: Global Logistics, Graduate Program
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOperations at Dyson plays a vital role in strategic decision making. Ultimately it affects the very design of our machines and the growth ambitions of the business. Challenging and diverse, their work creates a dynamic, driven team. Where the ‘next big thing’ relies on their ability to deliver agile, lean solutions as much as the inventiveness of Dyson engineers’ themselves. It’s one thing to solve a problem that’ll change technology forever. But turning that idea into a reality takes solving many more problems – and success is ultimately measured, not by the thinking, but by the product. Our Manufacturing department supports over 1,000 Dyson engineers worldwide turning ideas into groundbreaking technology. Involved early in the design, we identify materials, pre-empt production issues and find ways to build more efficiently. Yet robustly. From designing the machines, to the machines that build the machines, we’re helping to shape the future of technology. Market Overview Our Singapore story began in 2004 and today we have more than 1000 people working here. At the beginning of 2017 we opened our new, state of the art, Singapore Technology Centre in Science Park I, minutes from Singapore’s technology and start-up community. This new Technology Centre houses some of Dyson’s most advanced facilities including Robotics and Sensors laboratories and Smart Home, Connectivity & Mobile Applications laboratories as well as an Advanced Control Tower with the latest technology to develop its analytics driven activities. Not too far away is West Park, our flagship advanced motor manufacturing facility where we develop our autonomous robotic manufacturing capabilities – more than 300 robots assemble our Dyson Digital Motor (DDM) here. It is here that we develop our next generation of motor technology.  Function Overview The Global Logistics and IBP team is responsible for organization and implementation of a complex logistics operation. They plan, implement and control the efficient flow and storage of goods, services, and related information between the point of origin and the point of consumption in order to meet customer's requirements.
Requirements: RequirementsAccountabilities You can expect to be placed in roles that capitalize on your existing skills and stretch you out of your comfort zone, supported by personal and professional development and mentors to help you achieve success. This role may be a good fit if you are someone that is hungry for data, thrives on insights, and always dives deeper to understand the “why” behind numbers. You will be partnering with senior executives of the business and should be ready to apply your current skills, learn new functions, tackle business challenges and drive your own career. Skills Our most successful Dyson employees have more than just academic smarts – and we’ll expect you to have practical knowledge and experience that will help you contribute to our mantra of ‘wrong-thinking’ and doing things better. You’ll also need a head for data, great communication skills, grit, and a desire to learn. In this role, experience with SAP, tableau, and retail / sales is preferred. Some experience of a busy, deadline-driven environment would be great. But it’s not vital – we’ll teach you everything you need to know. It’s all about showing a passion for data and getting our products into the hands of our owners. We’ll expect a lot from you. And no day will be the same as the last.

The Role As a Market Research Manager, you will offer a strong marketing-driven data perspective while working closely with design, product and engineering. Willingness to iterate and experiment with ideas. Comfortable working with numbers on a daily basis and have experience dealing with multiple market projects concurrently Hands on experience in running market assessment strategies such as market segmentation of the industry including market size, market share and growth by product type, channel and region, sales and marketing strategies and new product opportunities. Strong knowledge understanding product lifecycle management process in a telco industry will be a strong plus Passion for marketing and, in particular, ad tech. Title: Acquisitions Marketing Manager, APAC Growth Marketing, Google Cloud - Singapore
Address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Google Cloud Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. The role: Acquisitions Marketing Manager, APAC Growth Marketing, Google Cloud - Singapore Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end. Shape the future of how technology is used in the workplace and be part of an entrepreneurial team in one of Google’s fastest growing businesses. As an Acquisitions Marketing Manager for Google Cloud’s Growth Marketing team in APAC, you’ll explore new ways, and lead efforts, to create explosive growth amongst enterprises who want to transform their business, processes and insights through the powerful solutions offered by Google Cloud.   Your responsibilities will include driving acquisition and growth in APAC, as well as collaborating on global programs, from creative development for upper funnel demand creation, through to driving trials, leads and conversion to paid customers with key marketing programs. You’ll craft and execute acquisition campaigns with a strong focus on performance, and drive optimization of the entire campaign experience, including driving demand for our sales teams and running tests on our website. You’ll also be the business owner for growing the revenue coming from our flagship Google Cloud products, namely G Suite and Google Cloud Platform. You'll work closely across the Google Cloud team to understand business needs, develop marketing plans, track growth and report results. Responsibilities:  Create integrated marketing campaigns that drive demand through the acquisition of net new customers for G Suite. Explore, grow and drive demand through new channels, like in-product integrations, paid media lead generation, mobile or co-marketing with external partners. Collaborate on global campaigns across three key regions (AMER, EMEA, APAC), and work collaboratively with the global team to synthesize learnings/data and create future strategy. Demonstrate accountability for achieving individual and shared goals, working closely with sales management, product management and global regional teams. Develop executive presentations to communicate strategy, priorities and results.
Requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications:  Bachelors degree with 4+ years of relevant experience  Preferred qualifications:  Clear knowledge of B2B users of Google Cloud products, i.e. target customers profiles and their needs/motivations. Experience with defining and launching successful enterprise software acquisition/demand campaigns, marketing optimization programs and website analytics. Strong project management skills and experience, e.g. managing external creative agencies, events vendors and international projects. Ability to create effective relationships to influence, and collaborate, across all levels. Skilled communicator with strong written and verbal communication skills, including both professional and casual style of communication. Distinctive problem-solving, strategic and analytical capabilities, with ability to run analysis, track metrics and optimize performance.

Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Technical Infrastructure Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible. The role: Technical Program Manager, Google Station - Singapore Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers. Additional Role Description: Google Station delivers sustainable public access Wi-Fi in developing markets via partnerships between Google and local venue owners, service providers and systems integrators. Google Station partners provide access infrastructure, while Google provides an over-the-top cloud managed service including monetization through advertising, onboarding services and analytics for the Wi-Fi network.  You will work closely with Google’s Engineering and Partnerships teams to introduce Google Station to prospective partners, perform technical assessments of those partners, and develop integration plans and designs that connect those partners’ networks to Google Station. As individual Google Station projects move from design to implementation, you will have the opportunity to work with engineering teams at Google, deployment partners and equipment vendors on network build-out.  You have strong communications and program management skills, coupled with a broad background in the design and implementation of commercial large-scale Wi-Fi access networks. Responsibilities: - Work with core teams to develop and articulate tactical plans and long-term strategy for Google Station deployments; initiate new programs in response to business needs. - Manage various programs of work while engaging internal and external teams in order to set the pace for development, deployment and delivery of networking systems and infrastructure. - Develop and prepare project documentation, process maps, presentations and tracking reports to provide detailed current status of each project. - Use your technical judgment to manage project delivery and technology reviews, challenge proposals and build consensus. - Analyze quantitative execution and system performance data and translate into recommendations and actionable plans, interpreting technical and commercial information from structured and unstructured sources.
Requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - Experience with Wi-Fi technology and vendor ecosystem. - Experience in design and deployment of multi-venue enterprise or carrier-grade access networks, including switching, routing and security aspects. - Experience in design and deployment of Wi-Fi networks, including RF planning to meet coverage and capacity targets. Preferred qualifications: - CWNP or Cisco networking and wireless certifications - Project management certifications  - Technical sales and consultation experience - Comfort operating in a high-paced global work environment with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks, manage time efficiently and navigate ambiguity - Strong written and spoken communications skills.

Title: Risk (Data) Analyst
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOrdering a pizza? Buying a pair of trainers? Watching a movie? Hailing a ride? Chances are Adyen is handling your payment. We are a fast-growing technology company, delivering seamless payment experiences to customers around the world.  Driven by a vision to improve customer experience, streamline processes, and ultimately increase revenue, we enable businesses to process payments across online, mobile, and Point-of-Sale (POS) with over 250 payment methods in 185 transaction currencies all over the world. Over 4,000 businesses use the Adyen payment platform, including Facebook, Grab, Spotify, Groupon, Evernote and Booking.com. As a part of our skilled team in Singapore, we need you to contribute to our growth in APAC, by supporting our biggest and most high profile merchants. Your risk (data) analysis will often be the starting point for new business opportunities, so you will make direct impact on business development, next to supporting flawless operations. The Risk (Data) Analyst works closely with other teams, such as Account Managers, Acquiring, Sales & Compliance teams, but is part of our Global Risk team. This position reports to the Team Lead Risk APAC.
Requirements: RequirementsYou will:   Execute risk assessments and (data) analysis related to fraud and chargeback for new merchants and monitor the risk exposure during the relationship of these merchants with Adyen. Advice on fraud redundancy to account management based on the data analysis. Provide the risk recommendations and the impact analysis of the risk recommendations to the merchants. Develop projects to improve risk management analysis and dispute management. Communicate with colleagues on execution and improvements of the fraud & chargeback avoidance or resolution. Determine the necessary data required to address questions, extract the required data, and perform risk analysis for the merchants. Clearly communicate accurate results in a simple and transparent manner.  You are:  Able to approach complex and multivariate calculations in a structural and analytical way Able to work in a high-paced environment with the ability to quickly shift priorities and produce consistent results Capable of effectively communicating complicated data analysis results in a simple fashion A self-starter. You take initiative and ownership and you dare to take decisions You have the ability to thrive in a start-up environment with minimal supervision Comfortable dealing with confidential information and you have high integrity Accurate and inquisitive A team player Fluent in English, both spoken and in writing A recent graduate with an academic bachelors or masters degree  You know and have experience in:  Database SQL Data analysis languages such as R, Python or Matlab would be an asset.   Preferably you have:   Experience in fraud analysis and risk management  Ability to analytically assess clients on risk exposure Enthusiasm to find creative solutions to mitigate risks related to fraudulent activities

The mission of this role is to help our clients identify their business opportunities or solve their business issues, by proposing optimal analytical solutions and delivering the analysis with actionable business insights, based on deep understanding of client needs and robust analytical expertise across varied Nielsen solutions. Once a project is commissioned, the individual in this role will collaborate with internal modeling hub on most solutions, translating client needs into detailed analytical requirements for the modeling hub, and drawing/reporting actionable business insights out of the modeling/analytics outcome to meet clients' business needs. Guide the modeling hub to ensure timely modeling execution following Nielsen quality standards. Interpret modeling outcomes from the hub with actionable business insights to fully meet client needs and company's quality standards. Assist in the analysis and report development for clients, including charting. Assist in answering inquiries from clients on the analysis of outcomes. Support senior members of the team in proposal development, including detailed solution specs finalization, collaborating with internal solution experts, and preparation for proposal presentations. Recommend improvements in work processes within area of responsibility.

Excellent communication skills, can articulate concepts simply and concisely to the point. Strong mindset on accountability, results oriented; one who takes initiatives & follow-through. Robust statistical knowledge. Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills. Able to convert ideas into powerful visualizations & charts.

Company: AMAZON WEB SERVICES SINGAPORE PRIVATE LIMITED
Title: Business Operations Analyst
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAmazon Web Services ("AWS") enables customers of all sizes to run their applications on Amazon’s industry-leading cloud computing infrastructure. AWS is growing very rapidly with hundreds of thousands of companies in over 190 countries on the platform. This growth is driving the need for an experienced leader on the ASEAN team to fill a high impact role.   AWS has a strong culture of data-driven decision-making; requiring timely, accurate, and actionable intelligence that delivers significant business value. We're looking for a hands-on and motivated self-starter who's passionate about using data to help us measure every area of the partner business and influence decision-making.   In this role, the ASEAN Business Operations analyst will work with the ASEAN, APAC and WW teams to continuously evolve forecasting models, analyze historic results, and make business recommendations to senior management based on those analyses – all in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity. This will include working with the ASEAN and APAC Operations team to develop, implement and manage the business processes, systems, reports and strategies that optimize business functions to meet organizational goals and initiatives.  Reporting to the ASEAN Head of Operations, the ASEAN Business Operations analyst will drive improvements to the reporting tools, methods, and processes utilized by the team to increase the availability and granularity of actionable data to AWS's management team. This position also manages the administration and execution of the team’s goals, measurement of goal attainment, evolving and driving various sales processes involving alignment between the partner and customer sales team and proposing improvements to the business to increase its effectiveness in driving desired results.  This role will focus on providing operational insight to our partner business, supporting the Head of Operations in day to day operational activities, and providing additional analytical insight to other Senior Leadership Team members as required based on strategic projects identified.   The successful candidate must be able to roll-up his/her sleeves, and work directly with the models/data. He/she will be passionate about their work, detail-oriented, analytical, and have excellent problem-solving abilities. He/she will be experienced at working with large data sets and the technical tools needed to work with them. He/she will have superb communication and customer-relationship skills, outstanding analytic insight, and be a passionate advocate for their customers to other internal parties. Active collaboration with leadership in AWS Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence, Business Development, Finance, Marketing, Recruiting, and Compensation will be crucial to the effective execution of the responsibilities. He/she will drive towards simple, scalable solutions to difficult problems, have excellent project-management skills, and be able to communicate complex analytical results, both written and verbally, in a clear and easy-to-understand way.   Responsibilities:    Collaborate on the design, development, maintenance, and delivery/presentation of forecasting models, metrics, reports, analyses, and dashboards to drive key business decisions across ASEAN  Working with the ASEAN partner management, lead the annual Goals, budgeting and ongoing forecasting processes.  Lead the development and provision of routine and ad-hoc analytic reports to AWS senior management regarding strategic initiatives, partner segment performance, performance against goals, etc. Ensure reports contribute to business insight and decision-making, and minimize overall report burden.  Lead the modeling and development of recommendations for partner coverage/capacity/competency planning aligned with targeted customer segmentation/verticals.  Maintain thorough knowledge of existing and emerging 3rd party data sources as needed for Analytics.
Requirements: Requirements Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or related field  Proven experience with the development and implementation of systems/tool utilized for SFDC, variable compensation, revenue reporting, forecasting etc  Expert level in Excel and Data query tools  Strong business-process design experience  Exhibits sound business judgment, a proven ability to influence others, strong analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ownership, leading data-driven analyses, and influencing results  Able to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization, and to create a vision and organization that can scale quickly  Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a track record of presenting to senior management       Preferred Qualifications:    Ability to build reports in web based tools e.g. OBIEE  Development of Excel Macros, VBA, Tableau Dashboards, SQL Queries  Ability to work well and productively, always projecting a positive outlook in a sometimes intense environment

Our goal is to become the bank of choice by providing superior services to customers and clients and supporting our stakeholders via a commercially successful business that generates long-term sustainable returns.   Our two clearly defined divisions, Barclays UK and Barclays International, provide diversification by business line, geography and customer, enhancing financial resilience and helping to contribute to the delivery of consistent returns through the business cycle. We have a strong core business with exciting prospects, well positioned to deliver long-term value for our shareholders.   Consistent with the objective of delivering long-term sustainable value for all our stakeholders, we have developed our Shared Growth Ambition – our approach to citizenship and the sustainability of the business model we operate. The aim is to make decisions and do business that provides our clients and customers, and the communities which we serve, with access to a prosperous future.   The delivery of our strategy is underpinned by the energy, commitment and passion of our people, and we are clear on our common purpose: to help people achieve their ambitions, in the right way.
