Title: Data Sciences & Analytics Engineer
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesSIA has implemented the Enterprise Information Management (EIM) platform which is the single, integrated and comprehensive repository of enterprise data. Our Data Engineering Team is looking for Data Engineers to help us continue to build out our data infrastructure, making available to the business users the right data at their fingertips and supporting the business in big data analytics.        Responsibilities of the Data Engineer include:       Administration and monitoring of the EIM systems to ensure EIM operations run efficiently with the desired SLA and security compliance. Monitoring performance and advising any necessary infrastructure changes to the EIM landscape. Work with the infrastructure teams to implement such changes. Design and develop architecture for data services ecosystem spanning Relational, Columnar, NoSQL, In-Memory, Data Warehouses and BI & Big Data technologies. This include designing and implementing data pipelines & ETL processes. Design data models for mission critical and high volume data management, real-time and distributed data process aligning with the business requirements. Promote and develop data architecture best practices, guidelines, procedures and repeatable and scalable frameworks. Work with business units on their analytics initiatives, providing the data science expertise and resources besides being responsible for extracting the data from EIM as required for the project. Work with analytics vendors, providing the data sets as required and support the business users in assessments & validation of the analytics/statistical & machine learning models. Work with and help business units with tools like Tableau to visualize and create dashboards with the relevant data in EIM. Work closely with our application teams to operationalise & integrate analytics/machine learning models into our production systems.
Requirements: Requirements BS in Computer Science or other related discipline is required. Advanced degree related to Analytics, Machine Learning & AI preferred. At least 1 years of relevant industry experience in following areas:   Knowledge and working experience with Machine Learning, AI, statistical techniques, and information retrieval as well as on data management systems, practices and standards. Knowledge and working experience with at least one visualization tools like Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik, or similar open source tools. Working experience in architecting highly performant databases using RedShift, PostgreSQL and Cassandra or NoSQL. Knowledge & working experience in Big Data technologies like In-Memory, New SQL, NoSQL, Hadoop Hive/Spark, etc Knowledge & experience in shell scripting, R, Python, Perl, Ruby, or any other scripting language. Should be proficient in at least shell scripting and R or Python. Experience with commercial ETL platforms with in-depth knowledge and understanding of ETL methodology & design supporting data transformations layer. Working experience with Ab Initio would be a bonus.   Strong knowledge and experience with Agile/Scrum methodology and iterative practices in a service delivery lifecycle is a PLUS. Working experience in an AWS or similar public cloud environment is another PLUS Excellent interpersonal & communication skills and proven ability as a problem-solver. Candidate to indicate in the application his/her strengths in data engineering and data science, and his/her preference.

Title: Content Marketer
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesNugit is looking for a content marketer who is passionate about telling stories. Nugit is powering the shift of data analytics from dashboards to data storytelling. Our mission is to liberate enterprises from complicated and manual data processes to deliver them high-impact insights that provide meaning and context in the form of Data Stories. This exciting new role will be responsible for establishing and developing a content strategy that will directly impact our lead generation efforts, sales pipeline and customer retention. This role will sit in the Marketing Department and report into the Marketing Director. The ideal candidate will have a background in content marketing and will be passionate about telling stories. You will directly contribute to driving qualified leads into the sales funnel through your content. Your key objectives will be content research, creation and optimisation. This highly collaborative role will work across various departments of the company, from sales to customer success. The ideal candidate has a passion for technology, an entrepreneurial spirit, resourcefulness, and a successful track record in developing marketing and sales content strategies that are tailored to buyer personas.   Roles & Responsibilities   Develop a scalable content strategy to enable lead generation via performance marketing channels, e-marketing, PR, social media and SEO.   Research key topics and industry-specific terminology of our buyer personas to develop content that attracts leads for each stage of the marketing funnel.   Create and optimise marketing content including short and long form written pieces, press releases, infographics, short videos, advert graphics, etc.   Manage the entire content journey, from ideation, research, creation, optimisation.   Set a pace and velocity of delivering content to support marketing campaigns, e.g. weekly, monthly, quarterly deliverables.   Establish and manage effectively a network of freelancers who will ensure you can keep up the velocity of delivering content.   Identify and develop content for marketing nurture programs, events, performance marketing and lead gen activities.   Establish and manage a social media strategy to drive brand awareness and lead generation.   Identify new content formats, optimisation opportunities and channels that can drive new sources of leads.    Analyse and forecast performance of all content marketing activities, establishing a regular reporting & communications cadence.   As a small company, work with colleagues to support other parts of the marketing program such as lead generation, PR, events, and Sales initiatives.
Requirements: RequirementsWhat you will need to succeed in this role:   Digital savvy with a strong understanding of all social media channels, marketing automation, sales and CRM systems and tools.   A creative mindset with experience in content research, ideation and exceptional skills in copywriting, graphic design and/or video editing, and audience engagement.   Strong understanding of optimising online content and SEO best practices.   Proven ability to drive and successfully execute content campaigns; and dealing with multiple projects and processes at one time.   Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret metrics around content marketing and adjust strategy accordingly.   Excellent time management, strategically prioritising multiple tasks in a proactive manner and can work with minimum supervision.   At least 3-5 years experience in a content and marketing role, and/or social media management.   Bachelor degree in Marketing, Communications, Multimedia, or other relevant field of study or equivalent experience.   Ideal candidate will be a team player and enthusiastic seeker of new ideas for improvement.   You will be passionate about making a difference; your ‘glass will always be full’ rather than half empty.   Resourcefulness and creativity to drive value at the speed of business.

Title: Performance Activation Specialist /  Executive
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesRole Purpose: At its core, the role of the Performance Media Specialist is to plan and implement paid media campaigns across all relevant biddable media channels / platforms to achieve the aims of Dentsu-Aegis group clients. The role is also a client-facing one - both externally, to the client teams, and internally, to comms teams, ATL planners, other digital specialists and client servicing. You will provide client management support for our priority clients, but will also be expected to be the lead point of contact on secondary clients within your team. Key Accountabilities: Client – facing responsibility • Be the secondary point of contact for priority clients within the iProspect performance media team. Clients have been grouped to ensure a good blend of DR/brand clients and prioritised according to billings/complexity. • Be the primary point of contact for a selection of secondary tier clients to ensure the effective delivery of campaigns. • Attend fortnightly catch ups with internal client teams in iProspect/Vizeum/Carat to ensure you are aware of all upcoming campaigns and report on campaign performance. • Attend and represent the team at regular external and internal client meetings, including status meetings, briefing sessions, campaign reviews, QBRs etc. Partner relationship management • Develop and foster an effective working relationship with our media partners. • Attend regular catch ups with our priority partners to ensure we continue to deliver the best in class campaigns and identify potential alpha / beta trials. • Assist with sharing client campaign briefs and seeking input from partners for responses to briefs where time allows. Team & Workload management • Mentor Performance executives / interns in the team and help develop their craft-specific and general client handling skills. • Ensure the timely and accurate delivery of work within your team. This may require you to undertake the responsibilities of more junior members of the team during periods of high workload. Client profitability and finance • Ensure the timely and accurate reconciliation of campaign spend / income by your team to ensure suppliers are paid on time, and clients are invoiced on time Performance media campaign planning & creation • Assist in the development of client performance media strategies to help define KPIs and strategy. • Take the initial campaign brief and be responsible for the creation of best in class, practical, accountable plans for delivering the business value our clients are seeking. • Where possible work closely with other digital and ATL channels to identify channel integration opportunities. • Be responsible for the development of clear plans and presentations to clients, internal agency teams and client servicing department detailing how a client’s objectives are to be met through performance channels. • Ensure all plans are delivered with the required level of rationale to enable client teams to competently relay the nuances of the plan. • Oversee creation of specific account elements within the campaign (toolkits, creative options, segmentation of the audience, ad copy, landing pages, and so on) to ensure this matches iProspect best practice. • Oversee creation of analytics and/or tracking tags for campaign assessment • Oversee the creation of additional campaign elements and/or restructure accounts as required Campaign Quality Assurance • Review all campaign builds completed by executives / interns to ensure they are accurate and in line with initial plan • Ensure campaigns are delivered as planned with no overspends or errors in delivery. Performance Campaign management, optimisation and analysis • Oversee the monitoring of daily delivery and perform ensure regular optimisation of all campaign elements (segments, creative, landing pages, etc) based on agreed campaign KPIs • Support executives / interns / partners to ensure regular reporting to clients is delivered according to schedule, working in partnership with our operations team. All reports are to be timely, accurate, literate and insightful. • Oversee the preparation of timely and insightful weekly and Post Campaign Analysis

Title: Forensic Technology & Discovery Services Senior Manager (Digital Forensics), Assurance, Singapore
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOur innovative Forensic Technology & Discovery Services (FTDS) team, a specialty group within Fraud Investigation & Dispute Services, provides leading technology and expertise in data driven support of complex litigation cases and business issues, allowing our clients and their counsel to make informed, strategic decisions. The services which we provide are wide ranging and include dispute resolution, fraud and other financial investigations, anti-money laundering, construction claims, licensing examinations and insurance claim reviews. We help clients proactively prevent and detect fraud, waste and abuse by leveraging the knowledge inside all of a client's structured and unstructured data assets. This is achieved by combining deep forensic investigation knowledge with advanced data analytics techniques such as investigative data linking, social network analysis, statistics, artificial intelligence, machine learning & predictive modeling. EY is on the cutting-edge in current trends in fraud and forensic investigations and serves as a quality-focused liaison between our clients and law enforcement. We have staff and offices in Hong Kong, Shanghai, Beijing, Singapore, Seoul, Manila, Kuala Lumpur and Jakarta, as well as Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Perth, Adelaide and Auckland. We are part of a global network of over 1000 forensic services professionals within the EY global organization.   About the opportunity In your role as a Digital Forensics Senior Manager, you’ll be:  Leading and supporting digital forensic investigations while providing incident response services to investigate, detect, analyze and respond to potential intrusions Managing high performing teams to perform onsite data collections, extraction, analysis Perform data discovery tasks in our secure digital forensic lab and our hosted forensic data center Leverage technology to continually learn, improve service delivery and maintain our leading edge best practices Building trusted advisor relationships with client executives and writing of business proposals Acting as a subject matter expert in advising clients to gain greater insight into their data and the value that strong data security practices can bring to an organization.
Requirements: RequirementsAbout you We’re looking for people with the following experience:  A bachelor’s degree and at least 8 years of related work experience At least one professional designation ( e.g. EnCE, ACE, CCE, CCFP, CISSP or GIAC forensic certifications, or be in the process of attaining one of these professional designations) Relevant, in-depth understanding of computer forensic principles including incident response, network monitoring, eDiscovery, or malware analysis Working knowledge of hardware configuration and network/data communications; software development and/or scripting; Database technology and database exploitation/forensics; law enforcement evidence seizure; and/ or conducting intelligence analysis and fact based reporting Excellent project management skills with strong written and verbal communications with willingness to travel Ability to conduct executive briefings at industry events / seminars and manage alliance relationships    What we look for We’re interested in leaders with a genuine creative vision and the confidence to make it happen. You can expect plenty of autonomy in this role, so you’ll also need the ability to take initiative and seek out opportunities to improve our current relationships and processes. If you’ve got the right combination of technical knowledge and communication skills and ready to take on some of our clients’ most complex issues, this role is for you.   What working at EY offers We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. We also offer you:  Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you    About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality. If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.

Title: Manager, Sales Effectiveness - SEAK
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWhat's your passion? Whether you're into yoga, chess or cooking, at IHG we're interested in YOU. We love people who apply the same amount of care and passion to their jobs as they do their hobbies - people who help us create great hotels guests love. At the moment we're looking for a Manager, Sales Effectiveness - SEAK to join our fun and energetic team at Singapore Corporate Office.    Job Summary – (Role Summary) The Sales Effectiveness Manager is responsible for designing, implementing, maintaining, and measuring sales standards, processes and best practices for Global Sales-SEAK Sales that will enable maximum performance from the EMEAA-SEAK Sales team. This role will manage the development and successful implementation of sales effectiveness strategies and programs; including developing and refining sales training for IHG Javelin in partnership with the IHG Way of Sales, redevelopment of key sales training programs to incorporate concepts related to Sales Challenger and Insight Selling. The role will also be instrumental in providing critical feedback to drive account production and identify best practices and/or sales skills gaps for additional sales training. In addition, this role will support key projects for Global Sales Effectiveness, including development, implementation and management of key communications, support of strategic and tactical programs, and analytics for SEAK leadership.   Essential Duties and Responsibilities – (Key Activities)  Define and drive sales effectiveness with internal and external stakeholders/sources to ensure the sales function continuously evolves in its sales standards, processes, and efficiencies to offer the greatest return to IHG, owners and customers. Provide strategic and tactical market and customer insight that will ensure that Regional Sales is continuously aligned to the correct account base and the correct deployment of resource to support the growth of the portfolio. Evolve the planning and reporting function of sales that ensures visibility, alignment and transparency of activity, while providing meaningful and insightful reporting to sales leadership. Work closely with the Director in technology within the SEAK Sales team. Continue to enhance, develop, and facilitate implementation of the sourcing, deployment, training, and managerial procedures for all sales technology systems such as IHG Javelin, IHG RFP, and MeetingBroker to ensure the sales team maximizes these tools. Work closely with Global Sales Team to manage all sales tools standards, processes and on-going training and adoption within SEAK Sales. Assist Segment Heads or other Sales Operations team members with on-going projects and communication of sales processes and standards. Manage and deliver monthly communications with the SEAK team on continuous improvement, adoption, and optimization of all sales tools & programs. Provide insight and analytics on sales tools; including oversight of data integrity and team member adoption. Deliver key account insight to enable sales leadership to evaluate such things as sales team account loads, key account activities, business development activities and opportunities, hotel related activities, RFP & leads data and other insight as requested that will help sales leadership to drive maximum revenues and sales contribution to IHG from key accounts. Work with Director/Senior Manager on implementing, measuring and auditing sales team use and adoption and provide on-going reports and information to sales leadership on sales tools engagement. Work with Global Sales & SEAK Sales team members on reporting data and other insight/analytics as needed / required by the Director and/or sales leadership.
Requirements: RequirementsEducation – Bachelor's degree in Business, Hotel Management, Sales/Marketing or a relevant field of work, or an equivalent combination of education and work-related experience. Experience – 6-10 years progressive work-related experience in the Hotel Industry, including national/global sales experience, with demonstrated proficiency in multiple disciplines/processes related to the position, as well as 2 years prior supervisory or team leader experience.   Technical Skills and Knowledge –  Demonstrated sales management experience in organizing, planning and executing large-scale sales programs, processes, and projects from conception through implementation. Demonstrated effective verbal and written communication skills for providing information to clients, vendors, senior management, and staff. Strong relationship management skills, and well-developed negotiating and persuading abilities required. Demonstrated proficiency in software systems for sales tracking, training and reporting purposes including Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, Microsoft PowerPoint, O365 and Outlook, Salesforce.com, and GDS connectivity knowledge, 1`1`1`ideally should also know/understand Holidex Plus and IHG Data mart systems, along with working knowledge of the transient RFP process and systems used for distribution of RFPs from clients to hotels. Demonstrated understanding of the contracting process for Groups & Meetings and working knowledge of Delphi FDC. Demonstrated knowledge of competitors’ sales strategies, positions, initiatives, and sales processes. Demonstrated understanding of training procedures and techniques, and ability to develop and present training tools and materials both in person & electronically. Demonstrated knowledge of hotel operations and systems, and demonstrated ability to develop effective sales plans using this knowledge. Detail oriented with demonstrated proficiency in analytics and reporting writing. Knowledge of IHG product & brands, sales & marketing programs, and key account management strategies. Demonstrated knowledge of electronic distribution – GDS & Internet, hotel operations, central reservations, global sales operations, Request for Proposal (RFP) process, and CRO/GDS rate loading strongly preferred.    In return, we'll give you a competitive benefits package including salary, discounted accommodation world wide and the opportunity to progress your career with IHG.  You'll have the chance to work with a great team of people, and most importantly, we'll give you Room to be yourself. So what's your passion? Please apply on-line and tell us how you can bring your individual skills to IHG. To find out more about us or any other jobs with IHG please look at careers.ihg.com

Title: Associate Project Engineer
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOther companies make products. We make a difference!  UL helps companies demonstrate safety, confirm compliance, enhance sustainability, manage transparency, deliver quality and performance, strengthen security, protect brand reputation, build workplace excellence, and advance societal wellbeing. Some of the services offered by UL include: inspection, advisory services, education and training, testing, auditing and analytics, certification software solutions, and marketing claim verification. We connect people to safer, more secure, more sustainable products, services, experiences and environments – enabling smarter choices and better lives JOB FUNCTION: Under general supervision, independently manages execution and timely completion of basic engineering projects by analyzing project scope and determining project specifications, establishing test programs for product investigations, analyzing test programs for adequacy and sequence, examining samples for compliance with UL requirements, and preparing reports for clients. Assists in the development of UL requirements, test methods, and test equipment. Exercises Project Handler Signature Authority as Project Handler of record responsible for opening, maintenance, completion, and closing of assigned new work engineering projects. May exercise Review Signature Authority as assigned as Reviewer of record responsible for initial review, status review, and final technical review of all new work engineering projects. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:  Determines project scope, develops a preliminary plan of investigation, and determines project specifications such as cost, time, and sample requirements by analyzing client input, available supplemental data, and product construction. Projects may include travel to conduct or witness tests at client sites. Initiates communication with clients to promote and explain the benefits of new and existing services. Follows up on contacts from clients. Communicates with clients to discuss technical issues, explain UL procedures and requirements, convey project cost, and negotiate completion date and sample requirements. Acts to address client concerns and to resolve client issues. Provides technical assistance to clients in reference to product inspection and follow-up services. Establishes appropriate test programs by reviewing files and manufacturer's information, examining samples, and applying UL requirements. Is familiar with applicable standards, company manuals and appropriate technical literature. Examines samples for compliance with UL requirements and notifies client of any areas in which the product is not in compliance or of any changes in project scope or specifications. Coordinates laboratory activities by preparing data sheets and instructions to technicians, scheduling and reviewing work of laboratory technicians and engineering support staff, and establishing completion dates. Coordinates administrative aspects of project management. Serves as Project Handler of record and may sign as Reviewer of record as assigned. Communicates project status and results to clients through frequent contact and by preparing reports. Prepares Follow-Up Service Procedures and information pages. Integrates continuous improvement concepts and techniques into all aspects of the job. Resolves engineering issues associated with Variation Notices by analyzing and reporting on the acceptability of the variations. Assists in the development of UL requirements. Assists in developing special test methods and test equipment. Analyzes test program for adequacy and sequence. May coordinate and/or perform File Reviews, as directed. May represent UL at industry related functions such as seminars and trade shows. Performs other duties as directed.
Requirements: RequirementsA successful Associate Project Engineer in UL should ideally possess a University Degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology, Industrial Technology, Manufacturing Technology, or Physics from an ABET accredited program plus two years directly related experience. He/She should ideally have detailed knowledge of the technical vocabulary common to the appropriate discipline as well as basic knowledge of laboratory testing apparatus and techniques common to the appropriate discipline.

Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. No wonder, then, that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence.   RESPONSIBILITIES The Living Analytics Research Centre (LARC) is a joint research initiative between Singapore Management University (SMU) and Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) that focuses on behavioural and social network analytics in the fields of Urban and Community Liveability, Personalised Urban Mobility, Jobs and Skills Intelligence, as well as Smart Consumption and Healthy Lifestyle. In line with Singapore’s Smart Nation goal, one of LARC’s objectives will be to harness technology to its fullest potential with the aim of improving the lives of Citizens and creating more opportunities. Candidates who join us can also expect to gain a deeper knowledge in the following areas: Big Data Analytics, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Deep Learning and other relevant disciplines. The Research Scientist will work with faculty researchers on one or more of the following research topics in the urban/social computing, smart cities and consumer business domains.  Data and Text Mining Machine Learning Deep Learning Crowdsourcing Recommender Systems Social-Urban Sensing Big Data Infrastructure    The Research Scientist will also be responsible for one or more the following:  Designing research methodologies Developing algorithms and models Conducting data science studies Designing and conducting experiments Designing and implementing applications, tools and systems Developing analytics capabilities in big data infrastructure
Requirements: Requirements PhD in Computer Science and related disciplines Good knowledge in relevant research topics and related research skills Proficient in at least one or more of these programming languages: Java, Python, C#, C++ and C

Title: Project Officer
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Delta-NTU Corporate Laboratory for Cyber-Physical Systems was jointly established by the School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering (EEE) at Nanyang Technological University (NTU) and Delta Electronics. The Corp Lab aims to create business value through collaborative commercialization of translational research and industrial development.  Successful candidates will conduct research and development work related to Smart Manufacturing. The candidates are expected to contribute in effort targets pave new solution business in Smart Manufacturing in the Asia Pacific Region. Established in 1981, the SCHOOL OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING (EEE) http://www.eee.ntu.edu.sg is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. Built on a culture of excellence, the School is renowned for its high academic standards and research. With more than 150 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,000 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world and ranks 6th in the field of Electrical & Electronic Engineering in the 2017 QS World University Rankings by Subjects. Delta Electronics was founded in 1971 and is a global leader in Power Electronics, Energy Management and Smart Green Life, with over 50 R&D sites globally and more than 5,000 R&D engineers. Job description: You will be responsible for developing machine learning algorithms in the context of team-based learning. The overall scope of the project involves the deployment of distributed microphones that communicate to each other. Received signals will then be converted to text for further analysis (using NLP). Together with a team, the initial job scope includes the review of machine learning algorithms for group-based discussion, survey of the latest techniques in this area and develop new algorithms. As a project officer, you will be responsible for the setting up of and integration of developed technologies within the team. This includes software development work and developing relevant APIs.   Job Requirements:  BEng degree in Electrical/Electronics/Computer Engineering/Computer Science; Proficient in Python, C/C++, Java, Object-oriented programming; Able to work independently and willing to co-operate with existing team members; Fluent in both verbal and written English; Highly motivated and able to commit the whole period of the project; Experience in top-tier publications 3-4 years research experience preferred. Soon-to-be PhD graduates welcomed to apply.  Application Procedure: Interested candidates please send your CV/resume to: Assoc. Prof. Andy Khong School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering Nanyang Technological University 50 Nanyang Avenue Block S2.1 Singapore 639798  E-mail Address for E-mailed Applications: andykhong@ntu.edu.sg Electronic submission of application is highly encouraged. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified for interview.

Title: Senior Deputy Director  /  Deputy Director, Special Projects
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesStrategy and Industry Engagement lead, Technology-Enabled National Healthy Population (TeNHP) The project is an endorsed Smart Nation initiative (first in a citizen-fronting deployable application space) and will involve the creation of a nation-wide platform to collect, through smart devices such as wearables, real-time and personalized biometric and wellness data.  Such data, matched to clinical records, can create personalized applications, delivered through smart devices, that will help nudge our citizens to healthier behaviours; predict or even pre-empt medical situations like stroke, falls and heart attacks; and improve chronic disease management and coordination of care across health, social and consumer entities. The platform is an open public-private one with government playing the role of a neutral and trusted data-broker to multilateralise data-sharing for health innovation and service delivery. This project has the ambition to create a step-improvement in health promotion and chronic disease management, pioneering capabilities with tech giants to front global-first co-innovation. It will also allow for the real time tracking of the Singapore population's health behaviours, and potentially give Government a much more accurate read of how the population responds to policy changes and allow for personalised services delivered at national scale.  By providing a research platform for new medical interventions, it has the potential to accelerate the adoption of a whole range of clinical interventions.  The project will involve a range private sector players coming in to use Singapore as a test bed to trial new products and services in precision health and medicine.  Key technologies that are likely to be trialled in this project are health related wearable and sensor technology, big data analytics, machine learning, behavioural science, genomics and precision medicine.      The Strategy and Industry Lead will assist the Coordinating Director to:    Strategise, plan and formulate the vision, implementation strategy and roadmap (including workstreams, team structures, timelines and budgets) for TeNHP; Reach out, assess, prioritise and implement key partnerships with private sector leaders in technology and healthcare sector to participate on our platform. This includes rallying and coordinating action from MOH and WOG implementation agencies and stakeholders (HPB, IHIS, Regional Hospital Systems, Govtech, SNPO, A*STAR, EDB, universities and research institutes), cutting through red tape to move quickly on joint industry engagement on all health technology matters; Manage, assess and report on overall project progress (business, technology, industry, policy, comms/marketing etc.), manage inter-dependencies and key project risks, and suggest adjustments to strategy and implementation plan to maximise value optimisation. This involves using new tools and coordinating beyond public sector to private sector partners as well in a cross-functional team.
Requirements: NONE

Title: Business Analyst
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesA World-Changing Company  At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us. The Role  Business Analysts at Palantir own the outcomes of all the work we do in Business Development. Business Analysts are experts in leveraging quantitative analytics across large datasets. They operate alongside the customer and close to the problem to selectively apply their skills where they can differentially cause impact. They don’t simply deliver quantitative or modeling outputs but assess how an analytic component can be part of a wider solution and work alongside engineers to build that for our customers. Business Analysts lead teams that build and support products: defining requirements, testing new versions, installing and configuring applications, and getting feedback from users about what’s working well and what isn’t.
Requirements: Requirements• Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Business Analytics, Information Systems or Equivalent; • Quantitative research or analysis; • Background in using quantitative data analysis methods, including data modeling, to analyze large datasets; • Prototyping solutions for quick iteration (knowledge of scripting languages i.e. Perl, a plus); • Background with distributed computation frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Storm, GraphLab); • Knowledge of databases to rapidly integrate data from such sources into analysis; • Background in deploying end to end product life cycles to clients, including release management, testing, and user communication; • Background in working with large and complex datasets, and identifying signal that are of utility to the organization/client; • Background in communicating technical concepts to nontechnical clients; and • Familiarity of Linux, Linux commands, and bash scripts.

Company: TECHNOLOGY CENTRE FOR OFFSHORE AND MARINE, SINGAPORE LTD.
Title: RESEARCH ENGINEER (TCOMS)
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Technology Centre for Offshore and Marine Singapore TCOMS is a national Centre of Excellence established by the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) and the National University of Singapore (NUS) to spur research excellence and advance Singapore’s Marine & Offshore Engineering (M&OE) industry. The Centre is also supported by the Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB) and the Maritime & Port Authority of Singapore (MPA), and seeks to develop and validate innovative concepts and solutions for M&OE operations. Through strategic global partnerships with industry and research institutions, TCOMS aims to push frontiers in the development of safe, reliable and sustainable future systems for mankind. A key feature of TCOMS is a next-generation Ocean Basin with forefront simulation capabilities. Job Description  Perform research in the areas of offshore hydrodynamics and fluid-structure interactions pertaining to ocean hydrodynamic environment and behaviour of marine & offshore vessels and floating systems in challenging environments Conduct extensive and high-quality research using combinations of physical experiments, sensing, numerical simulations using CFD and/or potential flow-based models or other relevant techniques, as well as data analytics to develop integrated physical-numerical modelling & simulations. Collaborate with industry partners, affiliated research institutes and other relevant stakeholders to assist in securing further research grants. Any other duties as assigned by supervisor.
Requirements: Requirements A Masters/Ph.D. from reputable universities in Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Ocean Engineering, Marine Engineering, Offshore Engineering, Naval Architecture or other related disciplines. Preferably 3 years of relevant postdoctoral/research/industry experience with competent knowledge in some of the following areas:     Deep knowledge in using CFD and/or potential flow-based models to model and simulate fluid-structure interaction problems, such as vessel manoeuvrability, sloshing, and multiple or coupled side-by-side floating systems, for example in offloading or ship-to-ship transfer. Physical modeling in wave flume, wave tank or ocean basin Knowledge/experience in sensing, data analytics, machine learning and/or control of model/full-scale systems will be an advantage. Knowledge of following software will be an advantage:       StarCCM+/OpenFOAM or equivalent, Hydrostar, HydroD or equivalent Ansys/Abaqus or equivalent OrcaFlex or equivalent     Good interpersonal and communications skills. Ability to adapt and work effectively as members of a team. Good command of written and spoken English language. Resourceful and self-driven with a high degree of professional integrity.  The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: Research Associate Position in Data Science and Analytics for Buildings
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAn unprecedented explosion of sensor and spatial data are being generated in the building industry. The Internet-of-Things (IoT) and building and energy management systems (BMS/EMS) are commonplace in modern commercial buildings, while building information models (BIM) capture geometric and meta data from the design phase. These temporal and spatial data are highly underutilized. Through their heterogeneity, buildings defy traditional analytics and diagnostics techniques and human ad-hoc analysis is unavoidable. A research associate position is available to focus on the spatial representation of building performance data in 3D.   To apply, please submit a cover letter specifying your research interests and experience, your curriculum vitae, a link to your ResearchGate, Github, and StackOverﬂow proﬁles to: Dr. ClaytonMiller(clayton@nus.edu.sg)
Requirements: Requirements2. Skills: Skills in building performance analysis in the 3D domain are required. Data analysis proﬁciency using tools such as Python, Pandas, R, Jupyter, and Github is highly desired. Some proﬁciency in Rhino/Grasshopper and its associated tool is required. 3. Experience: Desiredcandidatesshouldbefamiliarwiththebuildingandconstructionindustry through previous experience in design, project management or analysis of buildings. The position will require experience in temporal data analysis tasks such as supervised model development, unsupervised clustering analysis, and interpretation of results. 4. Qualiﬁcations: The candidate should hold or be nearing completion of at least Master’s degree with a focus in Computer/Data Science, Engineering, or Architecture.

Title: Data Scientist
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWHAT WE DO Niometrics captures, organises and extracts insights from some of the biggest and most complicated datasets that our modern societies currently produce. We put a magnifying glass on the realities collectively constructed by billions of connected individuals and machines, making sense of how humanity is re-creating wholly new digital universes with bits and bytes – universes that need to be seen, interpreted and explained. From taking deep dives into digital behaviours, to exploring the most intimate interactions between network technology and user experiences, we do it all. Our Data Science team consists of ambitious, creative and passionate individuals, united in the common goal of making a difference. With millions of users generating hundreds of TBs of data daily, our day-to-day job becomes an adventure of connecting digital signals with real-life habits to formulate granular audience insights – who they are, how they behave, and ultimately, how we can expect them to behave in the future. The action does not stop there – we also take pride in working with the latest high-end hardware and world-class software architecture. This means there are virtually no limits to the scope of future events we can model, giving us insights on not just people, but also the entire inter-connected ecosystem to which they belong. We are perfectionists and we do not hide it. You will join a thrilling environment, implementing and deploying data science solutions that are both efficient and secure, setting the basis for a groundbreaking software platform for the long run.
Requirements: RequirementsYOUR ROLE AS DATA SCIENTIST As a Data Scientist, you will work end-to-end, leading entire projects and owning their outcomes through their entire lifecycle. You will formulate hypotheses on structured and unstructured data, design experiments, draw meaningful conclusions and effectively communicate the results to business stakeholders. You will be part of a relentless team, curious to extract the highest value possible in the most effective way. You will put into action your machine learning skills, and together, we will build optimum algorithms for regression, classification, clustering, and information extraction. WHAT WE VALUE ● BA/BS (or MA/MS) or equivalent experience in applied Data Science. ● Proficiency in statistical packages and ML libraries for both big and not so big data (e.g. Python SciPy ecosystem, NLTK, Tensorflow or equivalent, Spark ML and MLlib, etc.) ● In depth knowledge of cutting-edge machine learning algorithms, as well as the strengths and weaknesses of the different methods and algorithms on different applications. ● Experience in Unix systems and scripting in bash. ● Proficiency in code optimisation (knowledge of Cython or similar).

Title: Sales Planner, New Business Sales (English) - Singapore
Address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Google Marketing Solutions (GMS) When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Marketing Solutions (GMS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. Together, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses. The role: Sales Planner, New Business Sales (English) - Singapore Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. Sales Planners (SP) help to grow and drive further business growth for the New Business Sales (NBS) team by providing them with accurate data and insights. With this support the NBS team can become more productive, focusing on the main sales activities. In this role, you'll collaborate closely with Sales Representatives while working on specific strategic tasks and assessing clients needs and challenges. In addition, you'll also works in close collaboration with Marketing to assess seasonality and vertical opportunities and challenges for NBS. Responsibilities:  Support Sales colleagues with top-level narratives, materials, analytics and reporting. Develop compelling storytelling pitches across Verticals, Products and Seasonal opportunities tailored to the specific clients and sector. Work in close collaboration with Sales colleagues to identify strategic business opportunities, based on quantitative and qualitative industry insights combined with Google data. Prepare in-depth, integrated, research-based presentations and proposals, building new strategic approaches to pitching our products and improving Google's reputation as a consultant and Partner. Use comprehensive knowledge of Google's products to align them with the client's Marketing Strategy, identify new business opportunities, and attend client meetings to support the sales pitch by deeply understanding Google, the client and market to deliver actionable insights. Acquire and share deep knowledge of each industry/vertical (e.g. competitive landscape, products, consumer behavior trends, key business issues, etc) in order to develop industry-wide recommendations on business development opportunities. Manage proposal and data knowledge base for sales colleagues. Develop new marketing sales collateral using industry, marketing and third-party research.
Requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications:  BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. 2 years of work experience in a data analytics fields. Ability to speak write in English fluently and idiomatically.  Preferred qualifications:  Experience in putting together C-level presentations, with demonstrated experience in advertising, sales, marketing and/or digital marketing. Demonstrated knowledge of SQL commands for report generation. Demonstrated knowledge of data visualization and associated tools (e.g. Google Data Studio, etc). Effective analytical skills, with the ability to see granular as well as big-picture issues and to quickly complete a large volume of high-quality work. Excellent creative and problem solving skills. Ability to speak and write in an additional local language (e.g. Thai, Vietnamese, Bahasa Indonesia, etc) fluently and idiomatically.

A PhD in the topic is a plus Substantial experience with Python, R, and or MATLAB Experience with processing location data, such as cellular, Wi-Fi, GPS, GTFS, OpenStreetMap, Google Maps… Knowledge of statistics including those in multivariate statistics, spatial-temporal statistics and time series analysis.

Title: Manager - Data Analytics, Advisory
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesBusiness has always wanted to derive insights from information to make better, smarter, real time, fact-based decisions: it is this demand for depth of knowledge that has fueled the growth of big data tools and platforms.  Our clients are increasingly looking to us to provide simple, innovative and effective approaches and processes by leveraging on cutting-edge data analytical tools and techniques. Join us as a Manager and you’ll play a key role in making that happen across multiple industries worldwide.   The opportunity  To extract value from big data, it must be processed and analyzed in a timely manner, and the results need to be available in a way that can effect positive change or influence business decisions. So whether you’re interested in data engineering, advanced analytics, data warehousing or visualization, we have a role for you. Whichever you choose, you can expect to work in a truly leading-edge environment, surrounded by some of the most engaging and knowledgeable colleagues in the business.   Your key responsibilities  This is a role where no two days are the same – so you’ll find yourself taking on plenty of new responsibilities as you go. You’ll work alongside clients and colleagues, balancing your time between developing security strategies, advising stakeholders, providing workshops and supporting business development. If you’re flexible and ready to adapt to a constantly changing environment, there’s no better place to develop your skills. Since you’ll be working directly with clients, some travel will be required.    Skills and attributes for success  Working on client engagement managing teams and carrying out both reactive and proactive analysis of large amounts of structured and unstructured data involving a wide range of advanced data analysis technology, database management software. Working with clients to explore and implement the best data-warehousing strategy to solve their business problems. Leading small and/or large teams on site to help clients leverage knowledge from their data for revenue generation, measurement and/or performance improvement purposes. Educating clients and key stakeholders on the benefits of data analysis and how it can be applied to their solve business issues continuously.
Requirements: RequirementsTo qualify for the role you must have  Bachelor's degree in a numerate discipline e.g. Information Management, Business Intelligence, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science with a strong computer programming component At least 8 years of working experience in consulting, analytics software-as-a-service or technology industry. Must have proven hands-on experience in the use of MSSQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Informatica PowerCenter 9.x,IBM Datastage 8.7,OWB 10.2,Informatica Data Quality,Informatica PWX tools Strong experience in data warehousing and development, especially ETL (Extract-Transform-Load). Exposure to all stage of data analytics project lifecycle (identification, extraction, load, transform/shape, analyze, report) both from a design and implementation perspective Demonstrable understanding of data quality risks and ability to carry out necessary quality checks to validate results obtained Familiar with ERP systems such as SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, Oracle, or PeopleSoft Articulate, with excellent oral and written communication skills Adaptable, able to interact and build strong relationships with people from a diverse range of backgrounds Intellectually rigorous, with strong analytical skills and a passion for data Sound logical reasoning and deep thinking ability Ability to work accurately to a high level of detail Travelling is required  Ideally, you’ll also have  Other data analysis / visualization platform (e.g. SQL, SAS, R, Tableau, Qlikview, SPSS) would be preferred skills Experience with big data analytics platforms such as Spark or Rapidminer would be an advantage Well-organized with experience of project management    What we look for We’re interested in flexible professionals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritise shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. You’ll also need the confidence to give professional advice and guidance to colleagues and clients from a diverse range of cultures, often with limited information – both verbally and in writing. If you’re a fast learner, with strong influencing skills and a genuine passion for information system security, this role is for you.  What working at EY offers EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:  Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you    About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.

Title: Infra Ops CloudPath Manager
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesDo you want to become a leader at one of the fastest growing software businesses in history? Would you enjoy tackling problems that have never been solved before in a fast paced start-up environment? How about rapidly scaling the infrastructure at one of the world’s largest cloud computing providers to deliver the best outcomes to customers? If you answered “yes,” then working on the innovative infrastructure challenges within Amazon Web Services may be the right place for you.  The AWS CloudPath Leadership Development Program is designed to be a fast track to leadership positions through exposure to a breadth of opportunities and challenges to accelerate learning. CloudPath is looking for high potential graduates who are ready for and excited by cutting edge innovations to tackle ambiguous problems and create competitive advantages. The chance to create solutions in an uncharted environment is both intense and incredibly rewarding. Delivering AWS Infrastructure at the lowest cost with the best in class customer service will stretch your leadership and problem solving ability to your full potential.  CloudPath participants can expect to lead high visibility projects, while mastering the tools, processes, and operations culture that have created a cloud computing leader within Earth’s most customer centric company. They will be driving efforts, both independently, and as part of larger teams, and will have a significant impact on the customer experience and the business. CloudPath participants have an opportunity to rotate through our Supply Chain & Procurement, Data Center, or Engineering organizations. These rotations are specifically designed to test a participant’s leadership and analytics capabilities. Great candidates think like business owners and drive results; look at a challenge, identify opportunities for improvement and build solutions to create the best outcome for our customers. In this 24 months program, you will be based out of Singapore for the first 12 months after which you will be given the opportunity to work in another cluster within APJC for the following 12 months.  For over 10 years, Amazon MBA programs have attracted innovative, talented leaders who are now highly influential senior leaders and executives in critical areas of Amazon’s business in locations all over the world. Join us as we continue to make history with AWS.
Requirements: RequirementsBASIC QUALIFICATIONS • MBA from a recognized Institution or be currently enrolled in an MBA program with a graduation before the start date • 10+ years of industry experience in Supply Chain/IT/Engineering/Data Center/Operations/Research · Senior management experience · Excellent written and communication skills PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS • Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results • The ability to dive deep into data and provide thought-provoking, workable business solutions • Demonstrated ability to think big and influence across all levels of an organization • Bias for action and passion for rolling up sleeves and doing what it takes to “get it done”

Title: GTM Programme Analyst
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Global Treasury Management Analyst position is a two (2) year rotational program across the J.P. Morgan Treasury Services division that prepares and trains entry-level Analysts with a bachelor’s degree for a permanent position upon completion. During the two year period, Analysts support teams that provide critical services to corporate and institutional clients for their cash management and payment needs. Analysts will be required to support the business through meaningful and challenging work assignments where they will strategically assess and analyze situations and develop creative and workable solutions with the supervision and mentorship of their teams and managers. Analysts are challenged on their analytical skills, strategic thinking, creativity and diligence, along with their technical and theoretical knowledge. The experience in the program provides Analysts valuable exposure to businesses and projects. These tasks are to be accomplished by the integration of the Analyst’s practical skills and theoretical knowledge, with the supervision and guidance of experienced colleagues and senior managers. Analytics   Structure and develop detailed and flexible quantitative models that analyze a variety of financial and non-financial business data on a product, solution, or client.     Financial Forecasts:        Build dynamic financial projection models for a particular business segment, product, or solution based on a detailed set of assumptions and an understanding of the business, the industry, and the financial forecasting principles. Present these financial forecasts to senior management for their review and agreement in order to drive future business decisions.   Market Sizing:  Estimate the market size and opportunity value of new or existing products, product features, and solutions. With a background on market sizing techniques and the manager’s guidance on the business, be able to determine the variables to obtain the opportunity value.   Cost-Benefit Analyses:  Assess the value add of our products and solutions to our clients. – Through a quantitative approach, calculate the dollar value of the benefits and costs associated with the use of the product or solution as well as the synergies of our partnership.          Optimize existing business focusing on profitable growth and improved efficiency, including international expansion, new business, market entry, and efficiency initiatives.     Client Targeting:  Following various client targeting strategies and the guidance of the sales specialists on the team, elaborate a list of top clients to target and focus sales efforts on. Though Analysts will be guided and supervised, they are expected to comprehend the basics of a company’s business operations, industry fundamentals, and the potential opportunities for our products and solutions.   Market Share Analyses:  Incorporating different market share analysis methodologies and market research, assess how well our products and business are performing compared to the industry, external competitors, and with other products and businesses within the bank. Provide managers with insightful analysis and recommendations on rationale, strategy, and product development opportunities.   Competitive Analysis:  Assess the top list of competitors and evaluate their key strengths and weaknesses and how they compare to our product offering. Evaluate differences and develop an insightful recommendation to management on the best market placement strategy for our product to address the competition and develop competitive advantage. Strategy       Create, own, and help deliver presentations to top executives and higher management within the firm. These include but are not limited to:     Strategy documents, business reviews, business offsite presentations, product roadmaps, etc. Analysts will be expected to incorporate their strategic thinking, insight on new trends and business techniques, and broader knowledge of business. These value adding contributions provide managers with fresh and new perspectives on the stories and problems they seek to address.
Requirements: RequirementsCommercialization   Assist clients to make and receive payments, and enable them to buy, finance and sell goods globally, invest and manage cash to increase their returns, and monitor and manage financial risks Work on solutions to help clients maximize the value of their working capital by optimizing their cash flows from transactions e.g. creating marketing materials and Pitchbooks. Foster innovation by identifying new and emerging business opportunities, such as data analytics, visualization, mobile applications, and accelerate speed-to-market through inorganic growth including partnerships. Identify, assess, and execute against acquisition opportunities that have strategic benefits to existing business (e.g., new capabilities, client segments, geographies). 	 Leverage competitive and market share analyses to assess emerging opportunities for the business and provide managers with insightful and informed recommendations to grow the existing business through new initiates, partnerships, and/or acquisitions.   Collaborate with functional partners in Product, Sales, Technology, Operations, Client Service, Marketing, and Finance around the world to gather information and insight.

Title: Regional Hardware Retail Marketing Manager, Google Assistant - Singapore
Address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Marketing Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself. The role: Regional Hardware Retail Marketing Manager, Google Assistant - Singapore Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end. The Google Marketing team is responsible for marketing the company's product portfolio to end users, partners and customers worldwide. Within Google Marketing, Retail Marketing is tasked with bringing the best of Google innovation to users in partners’ retail spaces. The team is developing new in-store designs, shopper experiences, and technologies to showcase the best of Google services, as well as Google-branded hardware. We work across global, regional and local Google teams in a fast start-up like environment, and in partnership with retailers, operators, and other channel partners, to bring our shared vision to life.   As a Hardware Retail Marketing Manager, you'll be involved with end-to-end product retail marketing strategy, where you'll help shape the future of one of our many Google hardware products and the Google Assistant ecosystem. From determining positioning, analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you will help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a consumer base. You'll work with cross-functional teams across Sales, Corporate Communications, Legal, Webmasters, Product Development, and Engineering. Responsibilities:  Be the voice of users and retailers in APAC to global teams, showcasing the unique needs of this region and leading retail innovations that can best serve the needs of the region. Manage the Google Assistant APAC Strategy and collaborate with Product, Hardware Partnership, Finance, Legal, and Compliance teams to develop and refine our Go-to-Market strategy for the Google Assistant 3rd party ecosystem in APAC. Partner closely with Google Assistant global and regional cross-functional teams to develop in-store journey, in-store visibility, training and measurement programs. Oversee the localization of global design assets and provide creative support to both internal and external retail partners. Initiate and execute new retail marketing programs at scale.
Requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications:  BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. 6 years of experience working in a hardware or retail company as a trade/retail marketing manager, account manager, channel marketing, or consumer marketing role. Experience working with cross-functional teams.  Preferred qualifications:  Demonstrated passion for retail and creating customer experiences. Ability to plan and manage at both the strategic and operational level and to launch new products in the market. Ability to manage ambiguity, solve challenges, and scale effectively across a large organization. Effective strategic thinking and execution skills with the ability to take complex data and distill them into a meaningful and coherent story. Excellent leadership and written and oral communication skills. Excellent business sense, project management and analytical skills.

Title: Senior Research Fellow
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCambridge Centre for Advanced Research in Energy Efficiency in Singapore is currently looking for a candidate to join them as a Senior Research Fellow. Who are we looking for? The project aims at a comprehensive virtualisation of an industrial park, i.e. a hierarchical representation of data and models associated with every entity in the industrial park, in order to exploit synergies for resource, energy, and emissions savings. The overall goal is, using ideas from Industry 4.0, Internet of Things, the Semantic Web, machine learning, and statistics, to create an expert system capable of providing quantitative decision support to stakeholders, planners, and policy makers. The successful candidate will be expected to assume intellectual leadership in the development of the theoretical and mathematical foundations as well as the wider, ongoing development of our main software tool. This will involve keeping abreast of the latest web technologies, making key design decisions, and ensuring their realisation. Being part of a 3-member consortium will require close interaction with collaborators. Activities will include participating in research discussions with local industries and partners, overseas universities, and writing reports as required by the National Research Foundation (NRF) of Singapore.
Requirements: Requirements A PhD degree in a relevant discipline such as mathematics, computer science, (theoretical) physics/chemistry, engineering, or a related subject. Excellent mathematical and programming skills. An outstanding publication record in at least one of the research areas concerned. Excellent oral and written communication skills. The ability to work as part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary team of researchers.

and be recognized for your work.  The successful candidate will have a unique opportunity to contribute directly to the success of the company and develop a long-term career with us.  If you believe and demonstrate that there are no limits to your potential, we will provide you with the runway to stretch yourself.   If you work with us, you will have to be enterprising, resourceful and independent.  You must be  self-motivated and are focused on achieving results.  Graduates with a few years of working experience are encouraged to apply and while a background in business is helpful, it is not critical.  More importantly, you must have a strong desire to learn and be comfortable working in unstructured environments.  You don’t think outside the box, you believe there is no box.  You wonder what can be, not what is, or is not.   This is an ideal opportunity for someone interested in corporate entrepreneurship – to exercise your entrepreneurial abilities in an environment where the resources of an established organisation exists to support.   All applicants are to submit a  cover letter with no less than 300 words expressing your interest for the position and incorporating  your achievements to date, your future short-term and long-term career goals and how you would expect a career at Vance  Group  to help you achieve these goals.  Also, don’t forget to hint at your leadership capacity and potential.  And to balance it out, reminisce on a failure or setback you experienced and what lessons you derived from that.   WE WILL NOT ACCEPT APPLICATIONS WITHOUT THE COVER LETTER.

Title: Central Team SPC Manager
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Description As a Manufacturing Quality Engineering SPC Manager, you will lead a team, and be responsible for SPC systems and Business Process management, Process control solutions integration in a Backend. In particular, you will lead a team, work with Backend Manufacturing Central Team (MCT) Engineering, Backend Site Quality teams and Global partners to provide direction and assistance with SPC and related Process Control functions.  Your team will help to coordinate and implement control systems across multiple international facilities with the aim at reducing overall product variation which will result in higher process margins, increased yield and reliability with lower costs. Other responsibilities include enablement of network aligned SIPOC data availability in Global Data warehouse, provide ad-hoc support for data analytics and script support for data extraction capability from tools to database. These responsibilities enable quality deliverables and cadence to be a global leader in memory and storage solutions.   Job responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:   Leadership and Innovation for Quality Solutions: •Provide direction and facilitate the practical application of SPC within Backend Manufacturing environment, covering all aspects including Business Process, interaction with Quality Functions. •Setting tactical and strategic vision for the team to bring innovation into the PCS technologies and how they are applied to Backend Network. •Build and maintain a team to support the eventual setup of network aligned SIPOC data, making such data available in GDW or equivalent database, provide support for data analytics, and data extraction capability for Defense line items of high priority. •Personnel and performance management and mentoring to ensure team members know where they are meeting expectations and goals as well as where they can improve development or performance •Provide a work environment that empowers employees to creatively improve their work environment, instills a sense of ownership and supports a team effort •Ensure all required safety training is complete and all work is conducted in a safe manner •Create the environment to foster and instill Benchmark Culture consistent Behaviors •Provide knowledge, resources & training (tools, systems, human resources, etc.) in order to enable our team members to be successful in meeting the technical aspects of their job. Ensure challenges/barriers to drive goals are always clearly identified, prioritized, and have solid action plans to address them •External communication to customer and peer groups to ensure we are keeping them apprised of activity, leveraging each other’s resources, and minimizing duplication of effort •Manage and coordinate resources, metrics, and systems to facilitate the achievement of quality goalsJob  Qualifications: •Have excellent supervisory and organizational skills with the ability to provide direction for the SPC, Fault Detection and related PCS functions. Global team engagement and leadership experience is a plus point. •You must be known as a results-oriented individual who obtains results through individual contributions and coordinating successful teams; be an individual who is dedicated to understanding and meeting customer needs and team goals; and be known as an individual with high standards of personal integrity •You should have the proven ability to solicit feedback, accept input, and analyze success and failure in order to improve personal and team effectiveness •Demonstrated strengths in "team building" with a strong focus on effective team dynamics and distributed responsibility •Excellent verbal and written communication, problem solving, analytical skills, reporting, and effectively present highly technical data •Proven ability to make sound, data-driven decisions •Proven ability to communicate and present effectively •Advanced understanding of SPC principles •Advanced understanding of PCS solutions including Fault Detection •Advanced understanding of database, deep learning •Proven ability to drive complex projects to completion •Demonstrated ability to partner successfully with other groups and build strong peer relationships
Requirements: RequirementsEducation Required •Minimum B.S. degree in Statistics, Mathematics, and/or Engineering with an emphasis in Applied Statistics   Experience Required •Minimum 3 years of experience in semiconductor industry applying a variety of statistical methods, including process control and metrology •Experience with Tableau, R, JMP, and/or other statistical software including scripting capability for automating analysis •Experience in the areas: statistical modeling, feature extraction and analysis, supervised/unsupervised/semi-supervised learning. •Ability to visualize and design database, fluent with various query languages and ability to apply data cleansing, outlier identification, and missing data techniques. •Strong software development skills. •Strong verbal and written communication skills. •A strong plus point if the desirable skillsets are available: •Machine learning and other advanced analytical methods •Fluency in Python and/or R •Hadoop (Hive, Spark, HBase) •Teradata and/or another SQL databases •Tensorflow, and/or other statistical software including scripting capability for automating analyses •Experience working with time series data, images, semi-supervised learning, and data with frequently changing distributions is a plus.Workplace Travel Required? •Yes Travel Details •Periodic travel to MFG sites for business purposes Travel Frequency •Not Specified Travel Duration •Not Specified Travel Type International

Title: Assurance, Fraud Investigation & Dispute Services Senior Manager, Singapore
